entry.title: Early intermittent hyperlipidaemia alters tissue macrophages to fuel atherosclerosis (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Early intermittent hyperlipidaemia alters tissue macrophages to fuel atherosclerosis

  • Minoru Takaoka
  • Xiaohui Zhao
  • Ziad Mallat
Article04 Sept 2024

entry.title: A Î³Î´ T cellâIL-3 axis controls allergic responses through sensory neurons (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
A Î³Î´ T cellâIL-3 axis controls allergic responses through sensory neurons

A Î³Î´ T cellâIL-3 signalling axis is defined that controls the allergen responsiveness of cutaneous sensory neurons, leading to evidence for an immune rheostat that governs sensory neuronal responses to allergens on first exposure.

  • Cameron H. Flayer
  • Isabela J. Kernin
  • Caroline L. Sokol
Article04 Sept 2024

entry.title: Frontostriatal salience network expansion in individuals in depression (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Frontostriatal salience network expansion in individuals in depression

Precision functional mapping shows that the frontostriatal salience network occupies nearly twice as much of the cortex in people with depression, and this was unaffected by mood changes and detected in children before onset of symptoms.

  • Charles J. Lynch
  • Immanuel G. Elbau
  • Conor Liston
ArticleOpen Access04 Sept 2024

entry.title: A local-to-global emissions inventory of macroplastic pollution (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
A local-to-global emissions inventory of macroplastic pollution

A global macroplastic pollution emissions inventory and methodology is developed using machine learning and probabilistic material flow analysis, to identify hotspots across more than 50,000 municipalities worldwide from five land-based plastic waste emission sources.

  • Joshua W. Cottom
  • Ed Cook
  • Costas A. Velis
ArticleOpen Access04 Sept 2024

entry.title: A climate threshold for ocean deoxygenation during the Early Cretaceous (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
A climate threshold for ocean deoxygenation during the Early Cretaceous

Rapid ocean deoxygenation during the Early Cretaceous OAE1a is shown to provide evidence for a strong link between volcanic CO2 emissions, weathering and ocean oxygen content that is characterized by a climate threshold.

  • Kohen W. Bauer
  • N. Ryan McKenzie
  • Sean A. Crowe
Article04 Sept 2024

entry.title: Recurrent evolution and selection shape structural diversity at the amylase locus (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Recurrent evolution and selection shape structural diversity at the amylase locus

The impact of structural variation on the evolution of the amylase genes is explored using human pangenome resources and ancient DNA data.

  • Davide Bolognini
  • Alma Halgren
  • Peter H. Sudmant
ArticleOpen Access04 Sept 2024

entry.title: CDK5âcyclin B1 regulates mitotic fidelity (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
CDK5âcyclin B1 regulates mitotic fidelity

Cyclin B1 is a mitotic co-factor of CDK5.

  • Xiao-Feng Zheng
  • Aniruddha Sarkar
  • Dipanjan Chowdhury
Article04 Sept 2024

entry.title: Immune system adaptation during gender-affirming testosterone treatment (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Immune system adaptation during gender-affirming testosterone treatment

Examination of immunological changes in transgender individuals undergoing gender-affirming testosterone treatment reveals sex hormone-regulated pathways in humans and explains sex-divergent responses in cisgender individuals.

  • Tadepally Lakshmikanth
  • Camila Consiglio
  • Petter Brodin
ArticleOpen Access04 Sept 2024

entry.title: Diverse viral cas genes antagonize CRISPR immunity (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Diverse viral cas genes antagonize CRISPR immunity

We demonstrate that phages have co-opted cas genes from CRISPR defence systems, which subsequently evolved anti-defence functions.

  • Mark A. Katz
  • Edith M. Sawyer
  • Alexander J. Meeske
Article04 Sept 2024

entry.title: Signatures of magnetism control by flow of angular momentum (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Signatures of magnetism control by flow of angular momentum

Signatures of magnetism control by the flow of angular momentum are observed in Pt/Al/Fe/GaAs(001) multilayers by the application of an in-plane charge current in Pt.

  • L. Chen
  • Y. Sun
  • C. H. Back
ArticleOpen Access04 Sept 2024

entry.title: Frequency ratio of the 229mTh nuclear isomeric transition and the 87Sr atomic clock (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Frequency ratio of the 229mTh nuclear isomeric transition and the 87Sr atomic clock

A vacuum ultraviolet frequency comb is used to directly excite the narrow 229Th nuclear clock transition in a solid-state CaF2 host material, marking the start of nuclear-based solid-state optical clocks.

  • Chuankun Zhang
  • Tian Ooi
  • Jun Ye
Article04 Sept 2024

entry.title: Gravitational instability in a planet-forming disk (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Gravitational instability in a planet-forming disk

Observations of gravitational instability in the disk around AB Aurigae using deep observations of 13CO and C18O line emission provide evidence that giant protoplanets can be formed from collapsing fragments of vast spiral arms.

  • Jessica Speedie
  • Ruobing Dong
  • Jun Hashimoto
Article04 Sept 2024

entry.title: An aberrant immuneâepithelial progenitor niche drives viral lung sequelae (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
An aberrant immuneâepithelial progenitor niche drives viral lung sequelae

CD8+ T cellâmacrophage interactions have a central role in impairing alveolar regeneration and driving fibrotic sequelae after acute viral pneumonia in a mouse model of long COVID.

  • Harish Narasimhan
  • In Su Cheon
  • Jie Sun
Article04 Sept 2024

entry.title: A polymer-like ultrahigh-strength metal alloy (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
A polymer-like ultrahigh-strength metal alloy

A polymer-like ultrahigh-strength TiNi alloy was fabricated by a simple three-step process to give a combination of a polymer-like ultralow elastic modulus and a steel-like ultrahigh yield strength over a wide temperature range, and such exotic properties arise from a unique strain glass state.

  • Zhizhi Xu
  • Yuanchao Ji
  • Xiaobing Ren
ArticleOpen Access04 Sept 2024

entry.title: DNA methylation controls stemness of astrocytes in health and ischaemia (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
DNA methylation controls stemness of astrocytes in health and ischaemia

Single-cell analysis of the transcriptome, chromatin accessibility and methylome of adult neural stem cells and astrocytes demonstrates that stemness is driven by methylation profiles distinct from those of astrocytes.

  • Lukas P. M. Kremer
  • Santiago Cerrizuela
  • Ana Martin-Villalba
ArticleOpen Access04 Sept 2024

entry.title: Global marine microbial diversity and its potential in bioprospecting (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Global marine microbial diversity and its potential in bioprospecting

Analysis of 43,191 genomes obtained from publicly available marine bacterial and archaeal metagenome data provides insights into marine bacterial evolution, CRISPRâCas defence and antibiotic resistance genes, and demonstrates the potential of marine metagenomes for biotechnological applications.

  • Jianwei Chen
  • Yangyang Jia
  • Guangyi Fan
ArticleOpen Access04 Sept 2024

entry.title: Alternating high-fat diet enhances atherosclerosis by neutrophil reprogramming (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Alternating high-fat diet enhances atherosclerosis by neutrophil reprogramming

Re-exposure to a high-fat diet in mice led to emergency myelopoiesis and increased neutrophils in the blood, which infiltrated plaques and released neutrophil extracellular traps, exacerbating atherosclerosis.

  • Jean-RÃ©mi Lavillegrand
  • Rida Al-Rifai
  • Hafid Ait-Oufella
Article04 Sept 2024

entry.title: Mechanisms that clear mutations drive field cancerization in mammary tissue (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Mechanisms that clear mutations drive field cancerization in mammary tissue

The authors use lineage tracing to map the fate of wild-type and Brca1â/â;Trp53â/â cells in the adult mouse mammary gland, identifying three layers of protection that limit the spread of mutant cells at the expense of allowing a minority of mutant cells to expand, which leads to field cancerization.

  • Marta Ciwinska
  • Hendrik A. Messal
  • Jacco van Rheenen
ArticleOpen Access04 Sept 2024

entry.title: The hepatitis C virus envelope protein complex is a dimer of heterodimers (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
The hepatitis C virus envelope protein complex is a dimer of heterodimers

Structural studies of a homodimeric arrangement of hepatitis C virus envelope E1/E2 heterodimers reveals the molecular basis of intracomplex interactions and  provides mechanistic insights into neutralizing antibody evasion and membrane fusion with host cells.

  • Elias HonerÃ¸d Augestad
  • Christina Holmboe Olesen
  • Jannick Prentoe
Article04 Sept 2024

entry.title: A pathology foundation model for cancer diagnosis and prognosis prediction (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
A pathology foundation model for cancer diagnosis and prognosis prediction

A study describes the development of a generalizable foundation machine learning framework to extract pathology imaging features for cancer diagnosis and prognosis prediction.

  • Xiyue Wang
  • Junhan Zhao
  • Kun-Hsing Yu
Article04 Sept 2024
